document_data.caption: A map showing the location of Yeshpek.
document_data.name: Yeshpek
document_data.mainbody: '''Yeshpek''' was a large fortified city in the [[Land of the Lions]] region of [[south Faerûn]].{{Cite web/More Lake of Steam and Dragon Coast}}
document_data.Etymology: Yeshpek was referred to by some as the City of Chains, due to its primary export. As for its proper name, a number of commentators and [[map]]makers in the lands north of Land of the Lions were known to misspell it on several occasions as Yeslipek. This was due to the city's name appearing blurry on a primary source map from the [[Fifth Age of Calimshan]].
document_data.Geography: This city was situated to the northwest of [[Tulmon]], along the [[Narrows Trail]].<ref> From its place along the [[Lake of Steam]], Yeshpek dominated the natural harbor of [[Bezrim Bay]].
document_data.Trade: Yeshpek was a center of trade of fishing. of different sizes and strengths, as well as locks. It was also known for trading of [[crab]]s and [[clam]]s. Beyond that, its populace crafted a variety of small everyday goods, such as belts, [[coffer|carry-coffers]], [[jug]]s, and [[whetstone|sharpening steels]].

Notable Locations.Businesses:
* [[Hyderfaulcon's House]]
* [[The Dancer's Blushing Mask]]
* [[The Fairshorn Wheel Inn]]
* [[Malasarr's Wayhouse Inn]]

document_data.Inhabitants:
As of [[1372 DR]], its population was around 23,000, with 19,000 of them being proper citizens of the city and other 4,200 being laborers who lived on its outskirts.

Beyond Yeshpek, elsewhere in the Realms its inhabitants were often known for being [[mercenaries]] or caravan guards, They were also known for being critical of others and viewing ostentatious shows of wealth and spending to be wasteful, despite displaying pride over their own goods.
